top_categories.workout_context: 73ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Sea Otter Europe Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
Sea Otter Europe Gravel's Spanish rolling, European gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 75 miles.
5,500ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
75 miles on spanish rolling gravel burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sea Otter Europe Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
At Sea Otter Europe Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Sea Otter Europe Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on spanish rolling gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 5,500ft of climbing on spanish rolling gravel does to your power file on race day.
5,500ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Sea Otter Europe Gravel’s 75 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sea Otter Europe Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on spanish rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: spanish rolling, european gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 75 miles of spanish rolling gravel in Girona, Spain.
